channel.title: The basics
channel.description:
[b][size=36pt]FOR STARTERS[/size][/b] I made this for people who needed it like me. To start off, Html, JavaScript, and other things you hear of are languages the computer reads. HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. An HTML file is a text file containing small markup tags. The markup tags tell the Web browser how to display the page. An HTML file must have an htm or html file extension. An HTML file can be created using a simple text editor. EXAMPLES [code=html4strict]
Dog:
Cat:
[/code] [b]JavaScript[/b] JavaScript was designed to add interactivity to HTML pages. JavaScript is a scripting language. A scripting language is a lightweight programming language. A JavaScript consists of lines of executable computer code. A JavaScript is usually embedded directly into HTML pages. JavaScript is an interpreted language (means that scripts execute without preliminary compilation). EXAMPLES An alert button [code=javascript] [/code] Java and JavaScript are two completely different languages. STOP ASKING! Alot of people think it is. Thats about it, I dont have to much to say, I didnt know what else to say so I just left you with the VERY simple parts. For more information, visit, W3Schools.com =D

item.title: The basics
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Here’s a simple action.

[size=1]

//These slashes ("//") will not be read in the code, so use them as comments. //All javascripts should begin like this, ending with a . //these are the most common and most simple tags, the input tags. They can be many things. Right now, we will make a Text bar where you can type the x variable, //aka the alert message, and a button, which will execute the popup() function. Notice the
, that is a tag standing for break, which will skip a line. We will put //the button under it.
//When you write down the execution function on the onclick, you don't write function before the function name. Functions are just shortcuts for the command so it's //either not messy, or you don't have to type the code again and again and again. Onclick will execute anything you put into it when you press the button. //If all gone well, it will alert saying "Your message was: MESSAGE HERE". [/size]

o yay.

Read full topic

item.title: The basics
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

[quote=“step one, post:1, topic:186963”][size=36pt]FOR STARTERS[/size]
I made this for people who needed it like me.

To start off, Html, JavaScript, and other things you hear of are languages the computer reads.

HTML

HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language.
An HTML file is a text file containing small markup tags.
The markup tags tell the Web browser how to display the page.
An HTML file must have an htm or html file extension.
An HTML file can be created using a simple text editor.

JavaScript

JavaScript was designed to add interactivity to HTML pages.
JavaScript is a scripting language.
A scripting language is a lightweight programming language.
A JavaScript consists of lines of executable computer code.
A JavaScript is usually embedded directly into HTML pages.
JavaScript is an interpreted language (means that scripts execute without preliminary compilation).

Java and JavaScript are two completely different languages. STOP ASKING! Alot of people think it is.

Thats about it, I dont have to much to say, I didnt know what else to say so I just left you with the VERY simple parts.[/quote]

i think you stole most of this from w3schools

Read full topic

item.title: The basics
item.dc:creator: @step_one step one
item.description:
@step_one wrote:

[size=36pt]FOR STARTERS[/size]
I made this for people who needed it like me.

To start off, Html, JavaScript, and other things you hear of are languages the computer reads.

HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language.
An HTML file is a text file containing small markup tags.
The markup tags tell the Web browser how to display the page.
An HTML file must have an htm or html file extension.
An HTML file can be created using a simple text editor.

EXAMPLES

[code=html4strict]

Dog:
Cat:

[/code]

JavaScript

JavaScript was designed to add interactivity to HTML pages.
JavaScript is a scripting language.
A scripting language is a lightweight programming language.
A JavaScript consists of lines of executable computer code.
A JavaScript is usually embedded directly into HTML pages.
JavaScript is an interpreted language (means that scripts execute without preliminary compilation).

EXAMPLES

An alert button

[code=javascript]

[/code]

Java and JavaScript are two completely different languages. STOP ASKING! Alot of people think it is.

Thats about it, I dont have to much to say, I didnt know what else to say so I just left you with the VERY simple parts.

For more information, visit, W3Schools.com =D
